items.name: SceneManager
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: SceneManager
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class SceneManager extends gs.ObjectManager
    ###*
    * Manages the scenes of the game.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class SceneManager
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: ->
        super
        
        ###*
        * The current scene.
        * @property scene
        * @type gs.Object_Base
        ### 
        @scene = null
        
        ###*
        * An array of previous scenes. Used to jump back to last scene from a menu for example.
        * @property previousScenes
        * @type gs.Object_Base
        ### 
        @previousScenes = []
        
        ###*
        * The next scene. If set, this scene will become the current scene after next update.
        * @property nextScene
        * @type gs.Object_Base
        ### 
        @nextScene = null
        
        ###*
        * The transition-data like the graphic, vague, etc. used for a transition from one scene to another.
        * @property transitionData
        * @type Object
        ### 
        @transitionData = { graphic: null, duration: 20, vague: 30 }
        
        @input = yes
        ###*
        * Called if a scene-change has been done.
        * @property callback
        * @type Function
        ### 
        @callback = null
        
        @paused = no
        
    
    initialize: ->
            
    ###*
    * Switches from the current scene to the specified one.
    *
    * @method switchTo
    * @param {gs.Object_Base} scene - The new scene.
    * @param {boolean} savePrevious - Indicates if the current scene should be pushed to previous-scene stack instead
    * of getting disposed. It is possible to switch back to that scene then using gs.SceneManager.returnToPrevious method.
    * @param {Function} callback - Called after the scene has been changed.
    ###
    switchTo: (scene, savePrevious, callback) ->
        @callback = callback
        if savePrevious
            @previousScenes.push(@scene)

        if @scene?
            @removeObject(@scene)
            
        @nextScene = scene
        
        Graphics.freeze()
    
    ###*
    * Clears the stack of previous-scenes and disposes all previous-scenes. After that it is not
    * possible to go back to a previous scene using gs.SceneManager.returnToPrevious().
    *
    * @method clear
    ###    
    clear: ->
        for scene in @previousScenes
          scene.dispose()
        @previousScenes = []
     
    ###*
    * Returns to the previous scene if that scene was saved before.
    *
    * @method returnToPrevious
    * @param {Function} callback - Called after the scene has been changed.
    ###    
    returnToPrevious: (callback) ->
        @callback = callback
        if @previousScenes.length > 0
            scene = @previousScenes.pop()
            
            if @scene?
                @removeObject(@scene)
                
            if scene?
                @nextScene = scene
                
                Graphics.freeze()
     
    ###*
    * Updates the current scene and the scene-handling. Needs to be called once
    * per frame.
    *
    * @method update
    ###   
    update: ->
        if @nextScene != @scene
            Input.clear()
            
            if @scene?
                if @previousScenes.indexOf(@scene) == -1
                    @scene.dispose()
                else
                    @scene.behavior.show(no)
                    #@scene.update()
            
            @scene = @nextScene
            @callback?()
   
            if @scene
                @addObject(@scene)
                @scene.loading = true
                @scene.loadingData = true
                @scene.loadingResources = true
        
                if @scene? and not @scene.initialized
                    @scene.behavior.initialize()
                    @isFadeOut = yes
                else if @scene?.initialized
                    @scene.behavior.show(yes)
                    @scene.update()
                Graphics.update()
                @scene.behavior.transition()
            else
                Graphics.freeze()
                Graphics.update()
                Graphics.transition(30)
            
                @isFadeOut = yes
            
        if @isFadeOut and Graphics.frozen
            Graphics.update()
            Input.update()
        else
            if @isFadeOut
                AudioManager.stopAllSounds()
                @isFadeOut = no
                if @scene
                    Graphics.freeze()
                else
                    gs.Application.exit()
                    
            DataManager.update()
            ResourceManager.update()
            
            if RecordManager.initialized
                AudioManager.update()
                
            if Graphics.frozen
                Input.update()
                
            super()
         
            

window.SceneManager = new SceneManager()
gs.SceneManager = window.SceneManager
